contest-event.event-date:
May 14, 2016 D British Open Spring Festival (Grand Shield) British Open Spring Festival (Grand Shield) 10 Test Piece Contest British Open Spring Festival grand-shield Winners back to 1952 are as engraved on the current Grand Shield trophy. Except for 1981 to 1984 where the bands on the trophy appear to have come second, not first! Was a different trophy given to the winners? If you know the answer please let us know.

There are also results on the trophy from 1902 to 1938, but they are for the Crystal Palace Contest (see link at top of page). Of Distant Memories Winter Gardens (Opera House Theatre), Blackpool, Lancashire, England, UK Best Instrumentalist: Kirsty Abbotts (cornet), Carlton Main Frickley. Top 2 promoted to British Open for Sep 2016, bottom 4 relegated to Senior Cup for 2017. Feb. 18, 2015, 3:58 p.m. May 15, 2016, 8:10 a.m. 1 Carlton Main Frickley Colliery Band Erik Janssen 2 Jaguar Land Rover Band Dave Lea 3 Hepworth (Cookson Homes) Mark Peacock 4 Whitburn Band Nicholas Childs 5 Aldbourne Band David Johnson 6 Tongwynlais Temperance Band Glyn Williams 7 Pemberton Old Wigan DW Band Kevin Gibbs 8 Wingates Band Paul Andrews 9 Reg Vardy Band Russell Gray 10 Ashton Band Philip Chalk 11 The GUS Band Adam Cooke 12 Kirkintilloch Band Garry Cutt 13 Unite the Union (City of Sheffield) David Hirst 14 Northop Band Andrew Berryman 15 Burry Port Town Michael Thorne 16 Camborne Town Band Kevin MacKenzie 17 City of Hull Band Stig MÃ¦rsk 18 Friary Brass Band Chris King 19 Redbridge Brass Alan Duguid 20 TCTC Group Band Jef Sparkes Withdrawn Marsden Silver Prize Band John Hinckley Withdrawn Mount Charles Brass Band Nigel Seaman
